channel.title: Proper way of defining Npc combat behaviors
channel.description:
I am having trouble defining how an Npc should behave while in combat. I want to avoid explicitly defining the behavior for each Npc. For a better understanding, let me show you a diagram of my current implementation:
[IMG]http://i1115.photobucket.com/albums/k557/Lord_Zymus/ClassDiagram1.png[/img] (note: First time using a UML editor. I omitted some unimportant details (npc level, current health, etc))
As you can see, the Npc class implements method [i]attack(Entity target)[/i] from Entity. However, all Npcs don't attack the same way. For example, a Goblin only attacks with melee, while Jad uses Magic, Ranged, and Melee depending on the conditions of the fight.
One solution that crossed my mind was possibly using a scripting language to define the behaviors. However, this was quickly disregarded when thinking about the implementation.
